course_title: Special Topics In Literature: Reconstruction, Civil Rights
class_notes:
(Complete Topic: Reconstruction, Civil Rights, and Sea Island Culture)
(For graduate students taking the course, a detailed handout of additional readings, additional assignments, as well as an augmented course project will be provided.)
(This course will introduce students to the "on-the-ground" history of Reconstruction and Civil Rights movement strategy through classwork, research in the Rose Library archives, and a study away collaboration with the Penn Center National Historic Landmark. We begin the course on Emory's campus spending some sessions in the Rose Library. For the last four class sessions we will join students from other area universities: Morehouse, Spelman, UGA, University of North Carolina, among others' on St. Helena Island, South Carolina at the Penn Center. Here we will learn about Gullah Geechee history and culture as well as explore Penn Center archives relating to the strategizing meetings held by the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC) and Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee. Students will participate in workshops, cultural events, and field trips while on St. Helena. Room and board and transportation costs for students will be covered.)
course_description: Various topics, such as theoretical, generic, or cultural studies of literature.
